availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Marshall R. Moore (Rockcastle County, Kentucky, tavernkeeper and examiner.)

body.p: Rockcastle County, Kentucky, tavernkeeper and examiner. Kentucky native. Married to Eliza J. Stigall Miller Moore. Father of Sarah Moore, John Moore, Catherine Moore, and Thomas Moore. Stepfather of Mason C. Miller. Tavernkeeper in Rockcastle County, Kentucky, in 1850. Examiner in Rockcastle County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Rockcastle County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, Northern District, p. 209A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, Mount Vernon, p. 586.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, p. 204B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, Mount Vernon, p. 33A.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 9183.
